The serjeant-at-arms looks you up and down with grudging approval.

'You've survived the mud, the marching, and the misery. No longer a green levy—you're one of the lads now, {PLAYER_NAME}. A proper Footman.'

You may now choose your military formation and specialize your training. Better equipment awaits at the quartermaster's wagon.

You're summoned to the command tent as evening falls over the camp.

'Word of your deeds has reached my ears, soldier. You've shown courage and cunning where others showed cowardice. From this day, you bear the rank of Serjeant.'

As Serjeant, you may now choose a military profession—Quarterhand, Field Medic, Drillmaster, or other specialized roles that grant unique abilities and bonuses.

Before the assembled company at the morning muster, your lord speaks:

'Step forward, Serjeant. You have proven yourself worthy of greater trust. I hereby swear you into my service as a Man-at-Arms. You shall command a lance of five soldiers in battle—their lives are now your responsibility.'

Visit the Command Tent to muster your personal retinue. Each soldier costs 2 denars per day in upkeep.

At dusk, as the camp settles, a runner summons you to your lord's tent.

'For valor shown and battles won, I entrust you with the company banner. You are now Banner Serjeant—a veteran of the highest order. Your command extends to ten soldiers.'

Your retinue capacity has increased. Visit the Command Tent to expand your forces.

Around the officers' fire, with the camp spread beneath the stars, your lord addresses the gathered veterans.

'Few soldiers ever stand where you stand today. By your blood and your blade, you have earned a place among my Household Guard—the finest warriors under my banner. Twenty men shall march beneath your command.'
